<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 392, 468, 408]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: List of Formulae (MF10)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 418, 390, 435]]<|/det|>
## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 448, 787, 464]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name in the spaces at the top of this page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 464, 327, 479]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 479, 504, 495]]<|/det|>
You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 495, 504, 510]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 510, 380, 525]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 540, 285, 555]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 555, 910, 586]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 586, 507, 601]]<|/det|>
The use of a calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 600, 910, 630]]<|/det|>
Results obtained solely from a graphic calculator, without supporting working or reasoning, will not receive credit.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 630, 608, 646]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 659, 606, 674]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 674, 757, 690]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [] at the end of each question or part question.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 78, 99, 98]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 72, 636, 109]]<|/det|>
Find \(\sum_{r=1}^{n}(4r-3)(4r+1)\), giving your answer in its simplest form.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 78, 920, 98]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 536, 92]]<|/det|>
Find the general solution of the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[393, 101, 608, 133]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{\mathrm{d}^{2}x}{\mathrm{d}t^{2}} +2\frac{\mathrm{d}x}{\mathrm{d}t} +5x = 4 - 5t^{2}. \quad [6]\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 109, 920, 128]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 628, 92]]<|/det|>
The cubic equation \(2x^{3} - 3x^{2} + 4x - 10 = 0\) has roots \(\alpha\), \(\beta\) and \(\gamma\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 103, 156, 122]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 103, 468, 122]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \((\alpha + 1)(\beta + 1)(\gamma + 1)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 103, 920, 122]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 504, 190, 523]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 504, 468, 523]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \((\beta + \gamma)(\gamma + \alpha)(\alpha + \beta)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 504, 920, 523]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 78, 154, 98]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 72, 376, 102]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(\frac{\mathrm{d}^2y}{\mathrm{dx}^2}\) at \(A\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 78, 920, 98]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 73, 880, 92]]<|/det|>
The points \(A, B\) and \(C\) have position vectors \(2\mathbf{i} - \mathbf{j} + \mathbf{k}, 3\mathbf{i} + 4\mathbf{j} - \mathbf{k}\) and \(-\mathbf{i} + 2\mathbf{j} + 4\mathbf{k}\) respectively.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 104, 156, 122]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 103, 432, 122]]<|/det|>
Find the area of the triangle \(ABC\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 104, 920, 122]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 73, 153, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 73, 670, 92]]<|/det|>
Find the perpendicular distance of the point \(A\) from the line \(BC\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 504, 193, 522]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 504, 640, 524]]<|/det|>
Find the cartesian equation of the plane through \(A\), \(B\) and \(C\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 505, 920, 524]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 72, 730, 92]]<|/det|>
The linear transformation \(\mathrm{T}: \mathbb{R}^{4} \to \mathbb{R}^{4}\) is represented by the matrix \(\mathbf{A}\), where

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[391, 98, 608, 168]]<|/det|>
\[\mathbf{A} = \left( \begin{array}{cccc}1 & -1 & -2 & 3 \\ 5 & -3 & -4 & 25 \\ 6 & -4 & -6 & 28 \\ 7 & -5 & -8 & 31 \end{array} \right).\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 184, 156, 203]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 184, 584, 203]]<|/det|>
Find the rank of \(\mathbf{A}\) and a basis for the null space of \(\mathrm{T}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 185, 920, 203]]<|/det|>
<mark>[7]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 151, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 73, 920, 128]]<|/det|>
The curve \(C\) has equation \(y = \sec^3 x\) for \(0 \leqslant x \leqslant \frac{1}{4}\pi\). The region \(R\) is bounded by \(C\), the \(x\)-axis, the \(y\)-axis and the line \(x = \frac{1}{4}\pi\). Find the volume of revolution generated when \(R\) is rotated through \(2\pi\) radians about the \(x\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 107, 920, 126]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 153, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 73, 537, 91]]<|/det|>
Find the coordinates of the turning points of \(C\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 512, 240, 530]]<|/det|>
<label>(iv)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 512, 240, 530]]<|/det|>
Sketch \(C\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 512, 920, 530]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 104, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 73, 156, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[161, 73, 462, 92]]<|/det|>
Use de Moivre's theorem to show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[346, 100, 648, 120]]<|/det|>
\[\sin 5\theta = 5\sin \theta -20\sin^{3}\theta +16\sin^{5}\theta .\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 101, 920, 120]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 104, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>11</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 73, 524, 92]]<|/det|>
Answer only **one** of the following two alternatives.

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 106, 201, 123]]<|/det|>
# EITHER

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 136, 156, 154]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 136, 920, 185]]<|/det|>
The vector \(\mathbf{e}\) is an eigenvector of the matrix \(\mathbf{A}\), with corresponding eigenvalue \(\lambda\), and is also an eigenvector of the matrix \(\mathbf{B}\), with corresponding eigenvalue \(\mu\). Show that \(\mathbf{e}\) is an eigenvector of the matrix \(\mathbf{AB}\) with corresponding eigenvalue \(\lambda \mu\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 166, 917, 184]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 504, 186, 522]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 504, 767, 522]]<|/det|>
Find the eigenvalues and corresponding eigenvectors of the matrix \(\mathbf{A}\), where

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[418, 530, 581, 581]]<|/det|>
\[\mathbf{A} = \left( \begin{array}{ll}0 & 1 & 3\\ 3 & 2 & -3\\ 1 & 1 & 2 \end{array} \right).\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 546, 920, 565]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 151, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 73, 326, 92]]<|/det|>
The matrix \(\mathbf{B}\), where

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[413, 92, 584, 144]]<|/det|>
\[\mathbf{B} = \left( \begin{array}{ccc}3 & 6 & 1\\ 1 & -2 & -1\\ 6 & 6 & -2 \end{array} \right),\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 149, 920, 203]]<|/det|>
has eigenvectors \(\begin{pmatrix} 1 \\ -1 \\ 0 \end{pmatrix}\), \(\begin{pmatrix} 1 \\ -1 \\ 1 \end{pmatrix}\) and \(\begin{pmatrix} 1 \\ 0 \\ 1 \end{pmatrix}\). Find the eigenvalues of the matrix \(\mathbf{AB}\), and state corresponding eigenvectors.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 195, 920, 212]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 153, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>OR</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 104, 888, 123]]<|/det|>
The polar equation of a curve \(C\) is \(r = a(1 + \cos \theta)\) for \(0 \leqslant \theta < 2\pi\), where \(a\) is a positive constant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 134, 156, 152]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 134, 241, 152]]<|/det|>
Sketch \(C\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 134, 920, 152]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 505, 156, 523]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 505, 479, 523]]<|/det|>
Show that the cartesian equation of \(C\) is

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[384, 529, 611, 551]]<|/det|>
\[x^{2} + y^{2} = a\big(x + \sqrt{(x^{2} + y^{2})}\big).\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 530, 920, 549]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 153, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 623, 92]]<|/det|>
Find the area of the sector of \(C\) between \(\theta = 0\) and \(\theta = \frac{1}{3}\pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 153, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(iv)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 824, 92]]<|/det|>
Find the arc length of \(C\) between the point where \(\theta = 0\) and the point where \(\theta = \frac{1}{3}\pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[433, 75, 564, 90]]<|/det|>
